SENT.plain: A rare case of spontaneous carotid-cavernous fistula with contralateral clinical signs (ocular discomfort, pulsating exophthalmos, chemosis, ptosis) is reported
It was associated with partial thrombosis of the ipsilateral cavernous sinus
It was cured with conservative treatment after six months
Anatomical knowledge of the cavernous sinus remains essential for better understanding of this original clinical presentation
